image.altText: Pictures of people on the beach and walking past Bondi Beach on a clear summer's day.

props.synopsis: Australia's mean temperature, the average of all minimums and maximums, was 1.46 degrees Celsius above the 1961-1990 baseline.

title.children: Heatwave looms as BOM confirms 2024 was second-hottest year on record

image.altText: Powerlines suspended between towers against orange dusk sky.

props.synopsis: Reporting profits and losses is standard fare in corporate Australia, but from this week companies will be required to disclose the risks and opportunities they will face under a warming climate.

title.children: New climate laws creating 'degree of nervousness' among company execs

image.altText: One man puts hand on another sitting down in kitchen

props.synopsis: Kassiou Constructions has been found to have engaged in professional misconduct by the building industry watchdog and received an almost $100,000 fine.

title.children: NT construction company handed record fine for professional misconduct

image.altText: The warm glow of heat lamps shines of green beans, mash potato and other hot dishes in a bain-marie.

props.synopsis: On a busy day more than 800 fly-in fly-out workers can pass through the dining hall at this mine in the Northern Territory's Tanami Desert, and feeding them is a mammoth task.

title.children: Remote mine's staff eat 16,200 eggs, 3 tonnes of meat a week

image.altText: Daryl Somers - a white man with black hair in a khaki shirt - pointing to a grassy wetland area with camels in the background.

props.synopsis: Never-before-seen NT cabinet records from 1994, released to the public for the first time, show cultural tourism, women's equality and Aboriginal employment were among the issues high on the agenda.

title.children: Why a 1994 tourism ad was a sign of the times for politics in the NT

image.altText: a man and a woman with a laptop

props.synopsis: Australian property prices are down but there is still a great deal of price divergence between cities — and years of soaring prices have left home ownership out of reach for many.

title.children: Property prices fall for first time in two years, as buyers finally hit a ceiling

image.altText: Legs on a pier with a light overlooking the water.

props.synopsis: With just a couple of well-timed hacks, you can maximise your time off in 2025. We'll show you how.

title.children: How to make the most of your annual leave in 2025

image.altText: An aerial shot of a Trump Tower in Las Vegas with smoke rising

props.synopsis: Authorities are investigating whether there is "any possible connection" with a truck attack in New Orleans that killed at least 15 people earlier in the morning.

title.children: Cybertruck loaded with camp fuel, fireworks before Trump hotel explosion

image.altText: A person wearing a HAZMAT suit inspects the burnt-out body of a Cybertruck

props.synopsis: Investigations continue into the explosion of a Tesla Cybertruck outside US president-elect Donald Trump's Las Vegas hotel.

title.children: What we know about the Cybertruck explosion in Las Vegas

image.altText: A two-storey building on a street, with signs saying "Bar One".

props.synopsis: Police in Fiji are investigating the alleged assault of two Virgin Australia crew members during a night out on New Year's Eve in the tourist town of Nadi.

title.children: Virgin Australia flight crew allegedly assaulted, robbed in Fiji

image.altText: Aerial picture of a home gutted by fire

props.synopsis: One home has been destroyed, and several more buildings have been gutted by a New Year's Day bushfire that devastated a community east of Perth.

title.children: Dozens of fires burn across hot, windy WA with another fire upgraded to emergency

image.altText: Mitchell Marsh wears his Baggy Green cap

props.synopsis: Australia's patience has run out with the struggling all-rounder as skipper Pat Cummins confirmed the team change ahead of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy series finale against India at the SCG.

title.children: Marsh axed from Test side as Webster set to debut in India finale

props.synopsis: The Australian dollar takes a dive for the first day of trade for 2025. A US investigation uncovers the target of an alleged Chinese hack of the US Treasury office.

title.children: ASX closes higher, Aussie dollar recovers, Chinese factory output lower than expected — as it happened

image.altText: A man in a work uniform stands smiling.

props.synopsis: The ship was in international waters near the Philippines when Gel Aguaviva went missing, and the Philippines Coast Guard is leading the search and rescue operation.

title.children: Search in international waters for crew member missing off Rio Tinto ship

image.altText: An older man looks out a car window from inside with his arm resting on the car, he has big teeth showing and is wearing a hat

props.synopsis: Chad Morgan is one of Australian country music's most recognisable pioneers, with his upturned hat, signature smile and country comedy hits. Fans are remembering his long career following his death on New Year's Day.

title.children: Country music icon Chad Morgan dies after 70-year career

image.altText: Elderly man with a walking cane seated on a deck watching the sunset over the lake, his wife beside

props.synopsis: Having a dementia village open in his home town means artist Henry Field can transition into care without compromising his feeling of independence.

title.children: Dutch care model changing the way people with dementia live

image.altText: Glenn Maxwell takes a one-handed catch in the BBL

props.synopsis: Glenn Maxwell is no stranger to freakish exploits in the field, but pulled off maybe the most brilliant fielding effort of his career on Wednesday night.

title.children: Maxwell hailed after taking 'greatest catch in the BBL' in Stars win

image.altText: an orange car drives along northbourne avenue

props.synopsis: Summernats organisers have pledged better behaviour than last year, but promise the annual car festival will manage to be "safe, well-managed, wild and vibey".

title.children: Promises of better behaviour than last year as Summernats kicks into gear

image.altText: Southern lights above a lake

props.synopsis: From Tasmania to New South Wales, Western Australia to Victoria, the night's sky was lit up by a dazzling aurora. They've become a regular occurrence in the past 12 months, driven by increased solar activity.

title.children: First big aurora of the new year brings 'a night to remember'

image.altText: Full car park in Hobart

props.synopsis: We've all been there — approaching the car after a long day and noticing a slip of paper under the windscreen wiper. But what if you aren't parked on a public street?

title.children: Do you have to pay a fine issued by the owner of a private car park?

image.altText: Singer Robbie Williams dressed in all one colour raises his arms in the air as he performs at the AFL Grand Final at the MCG.

props.synopsis: The UK pop star will perform a free concert for fans before being gifted a key to the city in honour of his contributions to Melbourne.

title.children: Robbie Williams to be given key to City of Melbourne

image.altText: An older woman with blonde hair and prominent facial features wears a rich-looking gown at night.

props.synopsis: The cosmetic surgery aficionado became a New York socialite after marrying art dealer Alec Wildenstein.

title.children: Swiss socialite Jocelyne Wildenstein dies

image.altText: White church stands amongst the palm trees.

props.synopsis: When Saibai Islanders were looking for a place to build their first church 150 years ago, they chose the highest point they could see. Now, it's sitting on the foreshore.

title.children: A church has stood on this site for 150 years — but it's never been more important

image.altText: An older woman rides a wave on a boogie board.

props.synopsis: A group of joyful wave riders' message of positive ageing spreads to shores around the world.

title.children: Granny Grommets inspire movement of older women as surfers

image.altText: Two police officers standing in front of a car on the street.

props.synopsis: The 45-year-old suspect is also dead, the Balkan country's interior minister says as three days of mourning are declared.

title.children: Gunman kills 10 people in Montenegro rampage

image.altText: A graphic showing a man running. He is superimposed over a blue background

props.synopsis: We've created a quiz aimed at testing your knowledge about the biggest health issues facing Aussie males. Give it a try and find out how you can improve your health.

title.children: How many drinks should you have per week? Take our male health quiz

image.altText: A police van outside an apartment block.

props.synopsis: NSW Police are investigating after a woman fell to her death from a unit balcony in Parramatta on Thursday.

title.children: Woman dies after seventh-floor balcony fall in Sydney

image.altText: Lang Lang seated at a grand piano facing toward the camera with one elbow propped on the lid and his head resting in his hand.

props.synopsis: Mozart and Chopin wrote their music hundreds of years ago. In recent months, their music was still being discovered in archives, and we can now hear what it sounds like.

title.children: Music lost for hundreds of years unearthed and brought back to life

image.altText: The four women stand in a group hugging each other and smiling.

props.synopsis: Adventure racing is a competitive endurance sport featuring non-stop multi-day trekking, using a map and compass to navigate via mountain bike, kayak and on foot. This all-woman team was the first to win a major international race. So why couldn't they claim the prize?

title.children: All-women adventure racing team won race, but couldn't claim the prize

image.altText: An underwater photo of a spear fun and shark swimming around a reef.

props.synopsis: A recent fatal shark attack in Queensland prompts warnings for people to be on the lookout for deadly marine creatures these holidays.

title.children: Fatal shark attack prompts warnings about deadly creatures

image.altText: NSW Police LIDAR speed gun

props.synopsis: As double demerit periods come to an end for the holiday season, participating states and territories say they make roads safer. But there has been no peer-reviewed Australian research on the topic for years.

title.children: Governments say data strongly supports double demerits for road safety

image.altText: An empty street with the rubble of a destroyed shop piled up on the side, and a tilted pole on the opposite side of the road.

props.synopsis: It's unclear when Port Vila's CBD, usually buzzing with holiday activity, will reopen to the public more than two weeks after a deadly magnitude-7.3 earthquake struck.

title.children: Vanuatu capital's entire CBD remains off-limits following disaster

image.altText: An Indigenous woman on a runway with an orange background wearing an orange dress with Aboriginal prints.

props.synopsis: Liandra Gaykamangu enjoyed being a high school teacher in Campbelltown, but felt something was missing. It wasn't until during her maternity leave that she decided to pursue a creative outlet — her love of fashion.

title.children: Why the New Year is the perfect time to change careers

image.altText: A man and a woman in Victorian clothes stand in the snow.

props.synopsis: At a time when vampires have been well and truly defanged in popular culture, Robert Eggers' resurrection of the iconic Nosferatu is a grisly fairytale that reeks of sex, rancid flesh and 2,000 rats.

title.children: Nosferatu remake is stunning while lacking real bite
